description: Coined by American chemist Robert Augustus Chesebrough in 1872, from German Wasser (“water”) + Ancient Greek ἔλαιον (élaion, “oil”) + English -ine.

examples: Hearts of putty, hearts of vaseline...

entries.meaning: Any particular kind of petroleum jelly or of any similar lubricant.
examples: A Russian vaseline has been lately added to the many kinds of vaseline found in  […]

entries.meaning: (informal) Short for Vaseline glass. or the colouring used in making it.

verbs.description: vaseline (third-person singular simple present vaselines, present participle vaselining, simple past and past participle vaselined)

examples: Even at this late date, vaselining will preserve the best of these leathers.
